metadata.Title: CVE-2019-1010305 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
libmspack 0.9.1alpha is affected by: Buffer Overflow. The impact is: Information Disclosure. The component is: function chmd_read_headers() in libmspack(file libmspack/mspack/chmd.c). The attack vector is: the victim must open a specially crafted chm file. The fixed version is: after commit 2f084136cfe0d05e5bf5703f3e83c6d955234b4d.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-1010305` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmspack0 - 0.5-1ubuntu0.16.04.4
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: mdeslaur> clamav in xenial+ uses the system libmspack, trusty uses the embedded one.

criterions.comment: libmspack package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.5-1ubuntu0.16.04.4').
